title: Bi-Weekly Career and Hiring Discussion Thread
selftext:
Hello r/india! If you need any suggestions/help regarding your career, ask here. If your company is hiring or if you are looking for a job, then post here.

**If You or Your Company is Hiring:**

1. Name of the company
2. Location
3. Requirements
4. Preferred way of contacting you

**If You are looking to get hired**

1. Your skillset/experience
2. Portfolio (if any/applicable)
3. Location
4. Preferred way of contacting you

Please do not mention your emails. You can/should prefer to take conversation forward in PMs instead to avoid any privacy mishaps.

Do follow up here with your experience. Did you get a job or hire someone successfully via these threads? Your feedback helps!

**Career Thread is posted every two weeks on Thursday mornings |** [**Old Threads**](https://reddit.com/r/india/search?q=Career+and+Hiring+thread&restrict_sr=on&sort=new&t=all)

https://preview.redd.it/osdztmrfx8n61.png?width=1487&format=png&auto=webp&s=dab56a83877ffe7dc6fd93767a8f63e9c366e592
comments: What govt jobs should I target as a BTech CSE fresher? (Excluding PSUs which hire based on GATE score)
Graduated in june 2022 (btech,cse) still unemployed. I know dsa as well as familiar with dev, if you have opportunities related to software dev it would be great

Skillset - Graphic Designing, Logo designs, Posters, Business Cards, T-shirt designs, getting into Ui/Ux as well

Portfolio - Instagram @PrimeLogoZ / Behance - [PrimeLogoZ](https://www.behance.net/PrimeLogoZ)

Location : India

Contact - primedesigns3905@gmail.com / Instagram DMs, its easier : )

- i am an Architect with 1 year 2 months experience 
- Looking for job as junior architect 
- preferred location: mumbai
- Kindly dm me for my portfolio and cv. I'll mail it to you.

Can join on immediate basis!

You can give IES exam but it is not available for CSE branch. You can study content of branches like ECE etc. to give IES. Also you can go for UPSC Civil Services exam or state admin. services exam. If you want that your engineering knowledge should be applied in a govt. job then PSUs are the only high paying jobs where you get placed in GENCO, TRANSCO, and DISCOMs. Other than that there could be railway exams, 2nd/lower grade exams in electricity board companies, bsnl where they hire through some state/central level exam. Do search for them on Google.
Will do. I knew of railways and bank exams. It's kinda difficult to find such stuff on Google for some reason
